May 2, 2026 General Election
----------------------------

Town elections shall be conducted in accordance with the
[Texas Election Code](https://statutes.capitol.texas.gov/?link=EL)
and held annually on the first Saturday in May. The Town of Providence Village contracts election services through the
[Denton County Elections Administration](https://www.votedenton.gov/)
. The Town of Providence Village General Election will be held Saturday, May 2, 2026, to fill the offices of Mayor, Town Council Place 1, and Town Council Place 6 for terms of three years. Election packets are available at Town Hall.

Application for a place on the ballot must be filed with the Town Secretary's office during the filing period for the election. The forms may be found on the Secretary of State website with additional forms on the Texas Ethics Commission website. The first day to file for a place on the ballot is January 14, 2026, at 8:30 a.m. The last day to file for a place on the ballot is February 13, 2026, at 5:00 p.m.

May 2, 2026, Applicants
-----------------------

[Linda Inman - Application Mayor](https://pvtx.gov/DocumentCenter/View/1310/Linda-Inman---Application-Mayor)

[Elise Jumbelick - Application Place 6](https://pvtx.gov/DocumentCenter/View/1324/Elise-Jumbelick---Application-Place-6)

View important dates from SOS
[2026 election dates.](https://www.sos.state.tx.us/elections/voter/important-election-dates.shtml#2026)

* Be 18 years of age or older on the first day of the term to be filled at the election or on the date of appointment, as applicable.
* Be a registered voter in the territory from which the office is elected as of the date of the filing deadline for a candidate's place on the ballot.

**Requirements from Section 5.02 of the Town’s Home Rule Charter:**

* Candidates for elective Town offices shall file for office in accordance with the Texas Election Code.
* Candidates for elective Town offices shall meet the following qualifications:
  + Shall provide proof of being a United States Citizen and being at least eighteen (18) years of age at the time of the election for which they are filing;
  + Shall meet all requirements to be a qualified voter set forth in the Texas Election Code at the time of the election for which they are filing; and
  + Shall have resided within the corporate limits of the Town, or recently annexed territory, for at least twelve (12) months prior to the filing date.
* No candidate may file in a single election for more than one (1) office or position established by this Charter.
* No employee of the Town shall continue in such position after filing for an elective office established by this Charter.

[Home Ruler Charter-Candidate Qualifications](https://ecode360.com/39738877)

A campaign Treasurer must be designated, and Form CTA filed with the Town Secretary before any contribution is accepted, or any expenditures is made. The form may be located at the Texas Ethics Commission along with instructions and the Town Secretary's Office maintains a supply of these forms.

[Linda Inman - Appointment of Campaign Treasurer](https://pvtx.gov/DocumentCenter/View/1311/Linda-Inman---Appointmen-of-Campaign-Treasurer)

Title 15 of the Texas Election Code pertains to campaign contributions and expenditures. Financial reports must be completed by the candidate of the candidate's Campaign Treasurer (signed only by the candidate) and filed with the Town Secretary. Campaign reports are public information.

* 1st repot due 30th day before Election
* 2nd report due 8th day before Election

If a final report is not filed, the Semi-Annual reports will be due each year on January 15th and July 15th.

If you have any questions, please contact the Town Secretary at 940-365-9333, ext. 413.
